item.title: By: Nate
item.dc:creator: Nate
item.description: hi Brian,<br/>I don't know anything about this - can you recommend something I could read about it? Just to prove that not knowing anything has never stopped me from mouthing off - I think it'd more of a resurgent than nascent biopolitics, I'm thinking of (the very little I know of) the Diggers, and there was the Catholic Worker movement in the US early in the 20th C... <br/>take care,<br/>Nate
item.content:encoded:
hi Brian,
I don’t know anything about this – can you recommend something I could read about it? Just to prove that not knowing anything has never stopped me from mouthing off – I think it’d more of a resurgent than nascent biopolitics, I’m thinking of (the very little I know of) the Diggers, and there was the Catholic Worker movement in the US early in the 20th C…
take care,
Nate

item.title: By: Keir
item.dc:creator: Keir
item.description: I think it was 30,000 squatters in London and 5,000 in Lambeth but then again no doubt both figures were snatched out of the air at an advisory service for squatters meeting in the back of a pub.
item.content:encoded: I think it was 30,000 squatters in London and 5,000 in Lambeth but then again no doubt both figures were snatched out of the air at an advisory service for squatters meeting in the back of a pub.
